I asked what exactly was wrong with "The Adventures of Ook and Gluk" that it was pulled from publication.  The representative wrote:  We always value hearing from our customers, and we understand your concerns. I am forwarding your comments about The Adventures of Ook and Gluk to our corporate headquarters. Thank you taking the time to share your feedback.  So obviously my question wasn't answered (and presumably won't be...one never hears from "corporate headquarters").

The initial contacts made with Cindy, Jennifer and Dawn were fantastic. However, Amy hasn't yet responded to my last email so it is still unresolved. The problem is that I ordered a large unit with drawers and it arrived with one drawer broken which I provided a photo of. The box was badly beaten up when it arrived. I was offered to send it back and get a new one but the box was too damaged to use for a return. And it seems excessive to send back a large heavy item when only a very small, light part is broken. I understand it may not be the normal procedure to open the box of an item and only send one part, but this is incredibly wasteful. This is a time where someone needs to think beyond just following the procedure which would be the normal for a book and do what makes the most sense. I'm frustrated that Scholastic isn't fixing this simply mistake. Things break in transit. I get it. I would like the broken item replaced.

I was very disappointed.  I feel like the person who was helping me did not even read my email and just sent me an answer without even trying to understand the problem.  The problem was solved but not because they helped me.  I feel if they would have listened to my situation, they would have been able to say, "checks take longer to clear and that probably is what the hold up is" but instead they assumed there was not an order and instead wanted me to ask the parent for personal information about their banking information which I find extremely uncomfortable and unacceptable.

I am very unhappy with the resolution. I did not do anything wrong. I purchased books that came damaged. I do not feel like I should now have to find a way to print a label and then package damaged books up, not in the box them came in since it's damaged, but but my own box, drive to UPS to fix a problem I did not create.
No Comment

I purchased a set of A-Z Mystery books (26 books) for $29.00 on sale under the Merry Values promotion. I received an email the following day stating the item was no longer available and my order was canceled. I looked online and the item was in fact still available however it was listed for the regular price of $68.00. I contacted Scholastic to ask why if the item was available at full price why it was not available to me for the sale price. The representative responded to me and stated that there were limited sets for the sale price and when they were all sold they were not restocked. I responded and stated that if that was in fact the case Scholastic should remove the sale price from the website and that was a bad business practice to let people buy and item for a price listed and then tell them it was not available. I never received another response.

I placed an order last week.  First, the order coming email showed that some books were not coming.   When I emailed about it, I was told that they would be coming, but were backordered.   Next, I got an email saying they were canceled.      Okay- so I went back on to order 6 more books so that each of my students would get a book for the holidays.   But now I would have to pay shipping because my order is less that 25 dollars.   I don't want to order 25 dollars worth- I already did that and I'm not paying shipping.    Disappointed that this didn't work out.   I had used Scholastic Books for many years, but stopped a few years ago due to issues just like this one.

I thought it was odd that I was contacted by a collection person for $50, and my most recent outstanding balance for $50 was less than a month ago. It seems like my first payment went to pay an October purchase (and an older outstanding balance), leaving a September purchase outstanding. I did not want to pay it off if somehow it was a different account. As we spoke, it showed up on my account. Something seems off with the software.
